alert.note: Alert for Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 9:39PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting White, Woodruff and Prairie Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Augusta affecting White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. White River At Batesville affecting Independence County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Georgetown. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Minor street flooding in Georgetown including Heath Scott Drive and Riverside Street near the boat ramp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date White River Georgetown 21.0 20.4 Thu 8 PM 21.7 21.9 22.1 23.0 6 AM 3/10 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
